name: Belote
overview: Belote (French pronunciation: [bəlɔt]) is a 32-card, trick-taking, Ace-Ten game played primarily in France, where it is one of the most popular card games both casually and in gambling. Within the game's terminology, Belote is used to designate a pair of a King and a Queen of a trump suit, possibly yielding the game's name itself. Game by Jean-Stéphane Martin it was to be published by E.S.A.T. Software but closed shop only a few days before the game was supposed to be released.
